1$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/17/2019 6:24:55 AM$Reviewer: rivermom66, 45-54 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was diagnosed with severe Adult ADD. I was put on this medication and the difference in my quality of life is like night and day. Mt bills have been paid ON TIME for 4 years now, I've stayed in the same home, I am organized. If I do not take this medication for a number of days then my house starts to look like the drawers and closets exploded. I have no ability to focus on taking care of individual tasks. It's just a difference of night and day. 
2$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/5/2018 6:34:35 PM$Reviewer: JLC , 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$This medicine has helped me focus on the tasks that I am going to get done. I have more energy and focus that is the plus side. The negatives are stomach cramping but it is tolerable. The positive out weights the negatives.
3$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/13/2018 5:48:46 PM$Reviewer: enorth81, 35-44 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$It has worked wonders on my memory and overall focus at work and in life in general.Never experienced any side effects and have been taking 10 m.g. in the morning and 5 m.g. in the afternoon.I have been taking it for the past 6 months.I recommend on your day off not taking any medication at least one day a week.I try to not take it at least 2 days out of the week to give my body a rest it will help you in the long run with balancing your weight and appetite
4$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/18/2017 8:02:44 AM$Reviewer: Missy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$4$It helps me to be able to concentrate on the every day activities and goals n helps me to be able to focus on one thing at a time
5$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/29/2017 6:23:14 PM$Reviewer: m.butler, 45-54 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I pay closer attention when people are giving me intuction. I also think it helps with my Depresion, which I was diagnosed with back in grade school; I am 49 now.
6$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/6/2016 11:55:52 AM$Reviewer: MuskieUguy, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$This generic
column2: in my opinion works the best for me. However it has a ""all or none"" effect
column3: meaning one minute it could be in full force

column1: It is however extremely effective and puts all the other generics to shame. I would compare this generic and its effects to that of Shires Adderall XR (name brand)
column2: really I would.

column1: The ""crash"" from this is no tap on the shoulder
column2: but rather a punch to the face. Lasting anywhere between 1-4 hours. (The crash seems to lessen if a blueberries are consumed at the first signs. Be sure they're USDA organic blueberries
column3: I've noticed conventional blueberries will only make it worse! But that's all just my opinion)

column1: The mood swings and irritability come randomly but not as bad with this drug.
Over all
column2: top notch!"

column1: 7$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/2/2015 3:24:17 PM$Reviewer: phill
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $2$2$3$I have taken adderall xr 20 for 10 years and it has always worked well for me. My prescription coverage through blue cross blue shield recently changed and they will not cover name brand anymore. The pharmacy will tell you dextroamphetimine is the same but if you compare the two on this website you will see they are not. So I will have to find another alternative because this med makes me loose focus and concentration

column1: 8$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/4/2014 3:47:39 PM$Reviewer: Tifs Mommy
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$5$Been taking 10+ YEARS and it has worked very well for me. I use the ER Spansule Caps (time release) for Adult Onset ADD due to other medical problems. When I worked I also used the 5mg tabs in the afternoons if I needed the extra boost
column3: but only if I had a meeting or something that required my full attention. Now that I am retired I only use the extended release spansule/capsule. I've not experienced any problems but WATCH THE GENERICS
column4: some release quicker than the brand
column5: while others release slower than the brand. For me I found a specific generic manufacturer and my doctor specifies that manufacturer ONLY on the scripts. Overall

column1: 9$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/27/2012 7:46:54 PM$Reviewer: BeverelyK
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver) $3$3$5$My 11 yr old niece has just been given this to take in the afternoon along with her Intuniv ER I am concerned any advice on a child this age taking this combination the Amphetamine ER is 10mg and the intuniv is 3mg ?

column1: 10$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/21/2012 1:25:47 AM$Reviewer: Shelly
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$5$I just started taking Amphetamine
column3: 10mg in the morning and 10mg around noon. I feel it has helped me focus on tasks and I have more patients. I can have a conversation with someone without my mind wondering off. I actually wait for the person to finish what they are telling then respond. I do find that I am not hungry and have had a little bit of a hard time sleeping but I have to say that the good out weights the bad. SO  far

column1: 11$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/17/2012 11:10:58 PM$Reviewer: Robertpro27
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$allowed to stay focused on the work and not get side tracted

column1: 12$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/31/2012 1:10:22 AM$Reviewer: corkbouy
column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$"I take 3 to 5 tablets of 5mg Dexroamphetamine daily in the morning or when I get up.  It is wonderful.  I wake up worried
column4: no ambition to start the day
column6: etc.  I/2 hour after taking the tablets
column7: I feel great and start my day an get things done.  My thoughts are positive
column9: enthusiastic and focused.  I love what it does to me.  I have ADD.  It gets me active and positive.  I take the 5 mg tablets because they are the cheapest
column10: and I can take 15mg or 25 mg depending on how I feel usually 20mg.  If I have a big day I take 25 or 30 mg if it is early
column11: like before 10am.  (I'm a night owl sometimes).  If I wake late in the day like 2pm
column12: I take 10 or 15 mg. so I will sleep.  I have a problem with my appetite and lost weight and muscle and I think was anorexic.  I lost 25% of my body weight and was thin to begin with.  It was scary.  I started eating 2 slices of Oregon trail cinnamon raisin with vanilla toast and peanut  butter butter sandwiches. 175 Cal. per slice and alltogether about 600 cal per sandwich.  I had cold potatoes to dip in sour cream
column13: and tried to force myself to eat throughout the day.  That is my main complaint.  I have to stop taking it because the price just went up from $25 co-pay per month to $125 copay per month.  I'm retired on medicare with a RX plan with Humana.  Right RX used to give me three months supply for $50.  Now it's $350!  I can't afford it.  I am thinking of switching to focalun
column14: my nephew used it and the generic is cheap as dirt. "

column1: 13$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/20/2012 12:07:34 AM$Reviewer: sarah23
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$3$5$This is my first time taking meds for adhd. I am taking Amphetamine/Dextroamphetamine salts er 20mg. Day one was awesome. The next few days I have been having trouble focusing. Not sure what happened. I will see my Doc in 2 weeks and maybe 30mg or simply taking two 15mg instant a day will work best.

17$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/24/2012 1:51:30 PM$Reviewer: Ashakin
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$3$I am on dexamphetamine and lexapro for ADHD combined with social phobia/ depression. I have 20mg 1 tablet Lexapro a day with food
column3: and 2 5mg of dexys 4 times a day daily so 40mg total... I hate taking them every day and frequently
column4: Overall it's stopped me from wanting to kill myself
column5: but it can cause sleep problems when I take the last lot by evening so I have run down a bit and felt grumpy but lexapro balances my lows and I haven't laughed and enjoyed myself socially like I have of recent for a long time. I am going to cut out the evening for I already was a night out LOL. I have a sore arm like in side muscle pain i feel and sensitive even when stretching out arm
column6: loss of appetite but trained myself to eat. I'm alot better
column7: but need to check why my arms sore :(  it has helped me career wise and set goals
column9: I am looking into more natural options down track.

column1: 18$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/29/2012 10:19:04 AM$Reviewer: tabletop
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$I've been on 30mg/day (20mg in am/10mg in pm) for almost a year. Hardly any side effects other than decreased appetite but instead of not eating
column3: it seemed to help me make better food choices
column4: so I've lost weight (and needed to) but it was healthy. In the last couple months I seem to be getting a bit more aggitated. Not sure if it's the meds or just the issues going on in my life. The being aggitated isn't new for me anyway
column5: so I can't say it's this medication that is the cause. I will speak with my dr about it
column6: however. It seems to be not working as well as it used to. Something else I'll be speaking to the dr about. I like this medication
column7: but am starting to get scared of it since reading the bad things about it. I use this for adult ADD.

column1: 22$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/27/2011 1:00:30 AM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$

23$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/9/2011 4:21:55 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I have been on Adderall for over a year now.  I have had to increase 2x.  I take 20mg in the am and 10mg in the evening.  I have a lot of trouble sleeping but that works to my advantage since I am back in school full time.  I have almost no appetite but I do not let it bother me.  I notice when I don't take it (like on the weekends) I seem to be a bit more anxious and paranoid.  I also feel depressed as it is wearing of.  This is the 4th medication I have tried to combat the problems I have with ADHD.  I have only been diagnosed for a little over 3 years.  Does anyone have any advice on behavior modification to wean myself off the meds once and for all?  I don't want to have to be on these meds for the rest of my life.

column5: talk to your Dr. about lowering the dose. I feel like it is ok to get out of bed now everyday
column6: I have the confidence that I know I can do it. I'm a great listener now.

column1: 31$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/25/2008 4:03:22 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I took this for many years before I lost my insurance.  I was in college at the time and it helped me tremendously stay focused on my academics.  I also discovered I had hep c and the use of drug helped combat the side affects of fatigue.  I have to admit though be wary of how much you are taking or you will find yourself not eating and no sleeping very often and the regular use of this drug can make the side affects of these symptoms oblivious.
